boardgame.name: LIGHT: STATIONDARK
boardgame.description:
Beacons, we've got a mission for you. All across the system we're getting readings of ancient space stations coming back online. We've codenamed these locations as STATIONDARKS.

They are not empty. Something has awoken inside of them.

The enemy is moving fast in an attempt to secure the stations before us. The information we could learn—and the technology we could capture—means that we must capture the STATIONDARKS before the enemy does.

LIGHT: STATIONDARK is a new Strike created for the Light Strike Jam. It is designed for LIGHT by GilaRPGs and the FUEL module for the same system. You do not need FUEL to use STATIONDARK.

STATIONDARK is designed to be generated on the fly as the Beacons move through the station. All of the modules are loaded with evocative details that make fights come to life in true cinematic, set-piece action.

In addition, this module is designed for multiple playthroughs if the Beacons wish it. Each STATIONDARK contains different modifiers for each of the modules, and before the Strike launches primary and secondary objectives are generated. Achieving these objectives grants the Beacons a chance for STATIONDARK specific gear upgrades.

boardgame.name: The Cathedral of the Stars
boardgame.description:
Out amongst the rocks and ice in the dark of the Kuiper belt hangs the ship. What was once a massive cold-sleep colony ship is now a twisted mass of metal darkness. Spires, towers, domes sprout out from the floating body like malignant growths. A dense haze leaking out from it obscures the light from the distant stars behind it.

What was once a ship is now a temple;

The Cathedral of the Stars

Board the Cathedral in a new, repeatable Strike for the rules-lite modular sci-fi RPG LIGHT. Each run through the haunted star ship brings you closer to terrible cosmic power with new abilities and weapons. Take your spoils and return to the Cathedral to fight against the mysterious Umbra enemy faction, or into other Strikes for a unique eldritch edge.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Anamnesis
boardgame.description:
Anamnesis is a solo journaling RPG about self-discovery, reflection, and identity. You play as an individual who has woken up with memory loss. You do not remember who you are, where you are, or what you care about. As you draw tarot cards, you fill the blank spaces of your past and learn more about your present.

Inspirations include The Wretched by Chris Bissette and The Portal at Hill House by Travis D. Hill and Lindi M. Farris-Hill.

All that is needed to play is a deck of tarot cards and a journaling method. The game is 10 pages long.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Love by the Quarter Mile
boardgame.description:
Rev your engine and prepare to fire the NOS. In Love by the Quarter-Mile, you play as a street racer trying to make it while fighting for family. This one-page tabletop RPG is quick and dirty, providing you with everything you need to use to play games in the same vein as Fast and Furious and Gone in 60 Seconds.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Phoenix King
boardgame.description:
From the Description:

Contains 1 powerful monster, a fire breathing mole, 4 uninspired minions and a magical item to make fighting all of that worth it.

boardgame.name: Among the Blood of Thine Enemies
boardgame.description:
From the Description:

There are 3 cultists among you. You have 24 hours.

boardgame.name: The Inheritance
boardgame.description:
The McClains are one of the oldest and richest families in Valley Falls. So when the current patriarch of the family, Edison McClain, asks for your help and is willing to make it worth your time, how can you say no? Edison was planning on naming his heir and the next head of the family. So he called together all of the McClains and proposed a game as a last test to see the worthiness of those he deemed had potential. But someone in the family had other ideas. During the family get-together, the McClain’s oldest and most prized possession, a medallion bearing the household’s coat of arms, was stolen. This 500-year-old family heirloom is believed by the family to be the reason for their wealth and success throughout the years. Without the medallion Edison can’t name his heir, and he fears the family will fall into ruin. Will you be able to find the thief and the medallion? Can you recover The Inheritance?

Difficulty Level - 7/10

boardgame.name: The Watcher
boardgame.description: Allison Zeller has a secret admirer. She thinks the mysterious guy is sweet enough at first until his behavior escalates past simple admiration and spirals into full-blown obsession. Someone is stalking her and growing impatient that they can't have her. This infatuation culminates in a full-blown attack on Allison's life, leaving her at death's door. It's likely that whoever did this to her will come back to finish what they started. Can you find out the identity of Allison's stalker before it's too late? Can you unmask The Watcher?

boardgame.name: DIX
TEN
텐텐텐
boardgame.description:
TEN is an exciting push-your-luck and auction game for the whole family! Players draw cards one-at-a-time, trying to add as many as they can without exceeding a total value of TEN, or they bust!

Players may push their luck to draw more cards and use currency to buy additional cards in their attempt to build the longest number sequence in each color. When valuable wildcards emerge from the deck, players compete in auctions to obtain them in order to fill gaps in their sequences

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Golden Geek Light Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Remnants of the Precursors
boardgame.description: Remnants of the Precursors is an open-source Java-based reimplantation of the 1993 game, Master of Orion. It plays mostly the same as the original Master of Orion, but has more modern graphics and sound, updated UI, and additional quality-of-life features and options.

boardgame.name: Oh Maker
boardgame.description:
You are an android, an artificial intelligence.


Made, not born.

Your Creator, your programming, and the world you occupy will vary, as will the scenes you play.
But the question remains the same.
To find its answer is the game...


Oh Maker is a N/A card-based game of communal story-telling, designed by Kienna Shaw (@KiennaS) and Jason Cutrone (@JustJasonPls).

In it, 3 or more players take on the role of androids who, through their own unique experiences and exploits, will come to confront their very nature. Select from 10 distinct Creators, those who gave the group form and function, and their respective worlds - or generate your very own - and utilize the various prompts provided to collectively explore the question of consciousness, and maybe even find some answers.

Included in this game are:


Concise instructions concerning Oh Maker's setup and gameplay, including "the passing process" and the X-Card
10 vividly written Creators and worlds with which to explore the question of consciousness
52 distinct prompt cards which help establish and define the nature of your connections in-game - to each other, to the Creator, to the world you occupy, and ultimately, to the answer
A PDF for alternate play without the custom decks



"You stand upon the precipice of consciousness. However unintentionally, the creator, your programming, the world you occupy - each lead you to this moment. Do you free your mind and become, or do you fall back into darkness?"


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: World Maker
boardgame.description:
Building a fictional world from scratch is a lot of work. Whether writing a story or running a tabletop role-playing game for a group of friends, it takes practice to build an intricate setting complete with warring factions, a timeline, and non-player characters who compliment the story. Often all this effort creates details that are never relevant to your players or principle characters. World Maker is an exercise meant to focus your energy into details, relationships, and traits that are relevant to your main characters or the players at the table.

Players: 1
Playtime: 1-2 hours
Requires: A deck of playing cards with the jokers removed, a journal or 4-5 sheets of paper and something to write with

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Wuhan-Baxter Employee Handbook
boardgame.description: Rules of play and career profiles

boardgame.name: Wuhan-Baxter Management Manual
boardgame.description: Rules for running games and an introductory mission - "Eurydice Incident"

boardgame.name: Wuhan-Baxter Mission Parameters Memo
boardgame.description: Guidelines for designing new missions.

boardgame.name: The Council
boardgame.description:
The world is under siege. As members of a global security council, you must work together to save the planet from invasion.


The Council is a cooperative strategy game played remotely via video chat (in person is ok too). Using a deck of cards, players take on the roles of security council members with different skills to secure sectors of the world and cancel the apocalypse in 20 minutes or less.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: THE COUNCIL: A remote play game

boardgame.name: Isogame
boardgame.description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players.

Each player has 4 tiles - 1 of each isogram. These are placed on their end of the board matching the isogram and the direction its facing (orientation). Using the roulette wheel, pieces are moved and rotated per the wheel's diagrams.

The goal is for one player to land their isograms on the matching squares (color and orientation) of the opponent's baseline (or his matching tile piece) and remove their own piece from the board. The first player to remove their four pieces from the board wins.

boardgame.name: Prime Ordeal: Genesis
boardgame.description:
In Prime Ordeal, two or more players take turns drafting armies from a "Spawning Pool" (a face-up collection of Creature and Bonus cards that all players have access to) to get ready for battle. Each creature has a Power Level, represented by a single number. These numbers are added together to form a player's Total Power Level when battling. As the game progresses, so does each player's army and Total Power Level.

To draft (referred to as "Create" in game), players discard combinations of Prime cards from their hands into the Prime card discard pile. Each Creature or Bonus card features a Creation Cost, specifying the combination of Prime cards necessary to create it. The Creation Cost may feature any combination of the following Prime card types: Bug, Sea, Bird, Reptile, Mammal, and Amphibian. Creatures themselves have types that directly correspond to their Creation Cost. Players are encouraged to collect creatures that share types to increase synergy and for better chances at acquiring Bonus cards.

After each player takes a turn Creating, the round concludes with a mandatory, free-for-all style battle. Each player's Power Level is compared and those with the highest or tied for highest Power Level win the battle, while each other player loses a Life.

Players draft in between each battle and the game continues until only one player remains with any Life. The amount of Life chosen before the game will determine how long a game lasts. It is recommended to start players at 7 (short game), 11 (medium-length game), or 13 Life (long game).

This strategic, card-based brawler features a modular design. The core set, Genesis, functions as a standalone game. Players may purchase expansions and shuffle them directly into the core set to change the game entirely. Groups may decide on which expansions to include and which to omit for a customizable gaming experience. Prime Ordeal is traditionally played as a free-for-all; however, its design accommodates team play as well.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: What A Terrible Night
boardgame.description:
'What A Terrible Night' is a no-prep, rules lite survival horror rpg. Players take on the roles of friends attempting to escape a terrible abandoned house. Randomly generated floorplans and items ensure that no two play throughs are ever the same.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Mingo
boardgame.description:
The game is designed to help familiarize one with the multiplication table. The objective of the game is to cover numbers on a circular board with their own markers. First player to do so wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Metcon: The Metcon Traffic Game
boardgame.description:
A traffic simulation game to teach road rules to new drivers.

Each player takes a pair of cars and moves them by rolling dice. Road hazards are introduced at numbered squares. Hazards are played out and fines assigned and paid at court.
Event cards give and remove points. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Horn of Plenty
boardgame.description: Horn of Plenty is a trick-taking card game in which four players win tricks by matching colors on cards and also gain generosity tokens by being nice to the other players.

boardgame.name: Planet of the Pugs
boardgame.description:
There was a devasted planet called Earth.
Once were habitated by human beings, and not only: then they came.
Pugs. All over it!

Planet of the Pugs is a cooperative game for 2 up to 6 survivors, running time about 20'-30', 8+.

During their turn, players can play up 2 action (a mandatory one + an optional one) then the Pugs run their cards, to determine Devastation.

Mandatory Action:
- Draw 2 cards

Optional Actions:
- Play 1 card from the hand
- Block Devastation – discard 4 copies of the same object to turn down by 1 level the Devastation and take a Special Relic
- Switch Object with other player

World Action:
- Draw many Devastation cards, looking to the players’ cards and to reached level.

Devastation bar has 12 levels and 4 steps.
Each step add a difficulty level like not to talk at all or play cards from other player hand.
The more Devastation bar increase the more World Action will increase too.

Three Ending Game Condition
• SURVIVE: the players get up to 5 Special Relics to create the Final Defense!
• DEATH: a player lose 3 life points
• DEVASTATION: the Devastation Counter reach the Max level

boardgame.name: Wordsworth
boardgame.description:
A 2-player word game using the same mechanics as Mastermind.

The Wordmaker (player 1) creates a word at the top of the board and hides it with a screen. The Wordbreaker (player 2) tries to guess the word by placing Yellow pegs in the board to indicate the letter and its position in the word. The Wordmaker than replaces the Yellow pegs with Black or White Pegs to indicate if the correct letter comes before or after the guessed letter. If the letter is guessed correctly, the Yellow peg stays on the board.

Points are scored for the number of tries it takes to guess the word. The player with the lowest total score of all rounds wins.

boardgame.name: NASCAR: Desktop 500
boardgame.description:
Start Your Engines! Now you can hold your own series on desktops everywhere!

Players decide on the number of laps they want to complete, and place their car in the lane of their choice. On their turn turn, they spin the spinner to either move their car the number of spaces indicated, or follow the directions of the black flag space indicated. Whoever completes the determined number of laps first wins.

boardgame.name: Slime Rancher - VR Playground
boardgame.description: The Slime Rancher: VR Playground is a standalone experience based off of the world of Slime Rancher!

boardgame.name: Slime Rancher - Secret Style Pack
boardgame.description:
Discover the secret styles of all your favorite slimes!

“Secret styles” are a brand new type of 7Zee tech which allows you to give your slimes a fresh, new look! Search for special treasure pods throughout the Far, Far Range and discover each slime’s unique secret style.

Once you unlock a slime’s secret style, you will be able to re-style every slime of that type on your ranch and on the Far, Far Range!

boardgame.name: Slime Rancher - Fashion Pod
Slime Rancher - Galactic Bundle
Slime Rancher - Heroic
Slime Rancher - Piratey
boardgame.description:
A Fashion Pod unique to the console it was bought on:

PC - Galactic Fashion Pod equipment, node, Beeper Bot toy, and Ruby Chroma Pack.
PS4 - Heroic Fashion Pod equipment, node, Bop Goblin toy, and Sapphire Chroma Pack.
Xbox - Piratey Fashion Pod equipment, node, Treasure Chest toy, and Emerald Chroma Pack.

boardgame.name: 最後の巫女 (The Last Kannagi)
boardgame.description:
A shrine maiden who protects the last land of endangered humans by "dirt". They have different beliefs.
At the same time as the final battle to protect humanity, it is also a faction battle of the shrine maidens.

It is a victory point system game that is played 24 hours x 5 days in-game time, focusing on human defense and belief rating.
The board is a hexagonal hex map, and it starts with "dirt" placed on almost the entire surface.

In addition to movement, the actions performed by the player include erection, blessing, prayer, dedication, and shrine maiden-like options.

The resource used for the main action is the "time" in the game, and the higher the level of the action, the faster the "time track" will advance. And the "person with the slowest progress of the time track" is the active player.
In addition, the collected and purified "Dirty", "Protection", and "Revelation" cards will help you in the process.

Collecting resources by collecting impurities, strengthening the company that supports it, and the unique ability of the shrine maiden in charge ... These are intricately intertwined, and the battle of humankind at the end is depicted.

-Google translation of publisher's website

『穢れ』により絶滅寸前の人間たちの最後の地を守る、巫女。彼女らはそれぞれ違う信仰を持っている。
人類を守る最後の戦いであるのと同時に、それは巫女たちの派閥争いでもある。

ゲーム内時間で24時間×5日間で行う、人類防衛と信仰の格付けをメインとした、勝利点制のゲームです。
盤面は六角ヘクスマップで、ほぼ全面に『穢れ』が置かれている状態で始まります。

プレイヤーの行うアクションは移動のほか、建立・加護・祈祷・奉納と巫女さんらしい選択肢。
メインとなるアクションに使うリソースは、ゲーム内の『時間』であり、アクションのレベルを上げるほど『時間トラック』が早く進みます。そして、一番『時間トラックの進みが遅い人』が手番プレイヤーとなります。
他にも、回収・浄化した『穢れ』や『加護』『啓示』のカードが進行を手助けしてくれます。

穢れを回収することによるリソースの収集と、支援をしてくれる社の強化、そして担当巫女の固有能力……これらが複雑に絡まりあい、終末の人類の戦いが描かれます。
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: 最後の巫女：反逆の狼煙 (The Last Kannagi: Hangyaku no Noroshi)

boardgame.name: Slime Rancher: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Slime Rancher is an award-winning, multi-million selling, sandbox adventure. Play as Beatrix LeBeau: a plucky, young rancher who sets out for a life a thousand light years away from Earth on the ‘Far, Far Range.’

Each day will present new challenges and risky opportunities as you attempt to amass a great fortune in the business of slime ranching. Collect colorful slimes, grow crops, harvest resources, and explore the untamed wilds through the mastery of your all-purpose vacpack.

boardgame.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Completionist Guise Promo Card
boardgame.description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the of the Multiverse. It was available with Ultimate Collector's Case and is also included in Complete Hero Variant Collection.

Completionist Guise

Innate Power: "Impressive Collection" - Replace a hero character cards in play with a variant of that hero. Put the replaced cards safely under this card. Either use the power on the replaced card (treating any hero names on that card as "Guise") or Guise deals 1 target 2 psychic damage.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Complete Hero Variant Collection
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Guise Hero Character

boardgame.name: SYNK!
boardgame.description:
The new, fast-paced card game that combines wordplay, trivia and a dash of deception!

Each round begins with a player selecting a card which will give them a secret word. They must then reveal the first letter of the word to the group.

Players then begin thinking of words beginning with the revealed letter. Anything goes! The aim is to come up with clues that other players will be able to SYNK with you without the cardholder figuring it out. When you've thought of your SYNK! word propose the definition to all players. If another player thinks they know you lock eyes, countdown from 3 and... SYNK! If the two players guess correctly then the next letter of the secret word is revealed. Now all players need to think of a word that starts with the first AND SECOND letter of the secret word. However if the cardholder also guessed the SYNK! word then it's back to square one. The game continues until a player thinks they know the secret word.

If a round comes to a halt with players struggling to figure out the secret word, then the cardholder must reveal its definition. The first player to think they know the answer must then shout “SYNK!”. If a player is able to either correctly SYNK! the secret word with another player or guess the word from the definition they win the round. If players SYNK! or guess incorrectly the cardholder wins. First player to win three cards is the victor and gets full bragging rights - until the next game!

—description from the publisher

These is a variant card for The Harpy (it has different HP/Power from the other card).

HP 27

Flip one control token. You may play a card.

boardgame.name: Nähdään Kosken Rannassa
boardgame.description:
Trivia game about one of Finland's cities, Tampere. The game has 900 questions and is suitable for everyone who wants to learn more about Tampere.

The name of the game means "See you at the rapids" and refers to the Tammerkoski rapids that run straight through the city (although now largely covered/developed) from lake Näsijärvi - itself one of the largest lakes in Finland and an important means of communication and trade before the advent of railways and the motor car - to lake Pyhäjärvi, and which the city was originally developed around; the rapids provided a ready source of power for the weaving mills, paper mills, engineering works etc. of the emerging industrial revolution of the 19th century and started Tampere on the path to becoming what it now is.

The game is basically the Tampere edition of Nähdään kellon alla!, the original version set in Helsinki.

boardgame.name: Mist Fleet
雾海舰队
boardgame.description:
In Mist Fleet, each player leads a battleship fleet. The object of the game is destroy all of your opponent's ships.
In each turn player fire cannon to opponent's fleet, opponent announce hit or miss, but they can lie.But this game is also suitable for those are not good at lying, because all lying ablity is given by ship itself.

Each player has 6 ships and 6 empty sea cards,place their 12 cards face down to form a 4x3 formation
Each player on his turn has 2 actions.
For each action, player has 3 options
1) Attack directly: attack 1 of opponent's card. The opponent look at his card. If it is a ship, he say “Hit”, if it is not a ship, he say “Miss”. Put “Hit” or “Miss” token on that card.
2）Attack adjacently: attack a space between two cards. The opponent look at both his cards. If either of them is a ship, he say “Hit”; if neither of them is a ship, he say “Miss”. Place “Hit” or “Miss” token between margin of two cards.
Whenever a ship's life point is equal of below 0 (life points on card minus “Hit” on the ship card and around the ship card), the ship is sunk. Ship's owner shall flip the card face up.
3) Radar scan. Scan one cross point of two margin lines. Opponent look at his cards around scan point.Opponent count all this cards current life point and say that number. Put a radar scan number token on that point.

Basic game is for 2 players. Support up to 4 players by using two copies of game.

在《雾海舰队》中，玩家将带领自己的舰队，在迷雾之海中与对手决战。玩家可以通过炮击或雷达扫描的方式，找出并摧毁对手的舰队。最先击毁敌方所有战舰的玩家获胜。
