boardgame.name: FAD
boardgame.description:
FAD is a 2 player card game that puts you in the heart of gameplay. Score points by doing 'Activities' with your 'Friends', while avoiding any 'Delays'. The first to 100 points wins. The game is available as a print & play product.

Design your own character from a series of pre-made faces (like in a computer game RPG) to bring yourself into the game.

The game is a really fun, super easy to learn, card game with strategy and a little bit of luck.

There are 120 cards including:

x60 Friends cards
x30 Activity cards
x30 Delay card

boardgame.name: Drachenzeit (Issue 4 - 1988)
boardgame.description: contains a scenario, town description, new monster, club news, etc.

boardgame.name: Lakelandopoly
boardgame.description: How do you make a game about the great city of Lakeland, FL? While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the LAKELAND we could into this box. It's full of family fun, outdoor activities, Florida history and of course... lakes, a little something for everyone! Looking for a fun way to experience Swan City? Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy your favorite LAKELAND properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! Get your game on! So choose your token and advance to GO LAKELAND! You may soon be the Mayor...or out of the game for eating too much pizza at the Silver Moon Snack Bar.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company

boardgame.name: Talita
boardgame.description:
The Talisman Pocket Game

Comes in a paper bag with illustration and title on the front and rules of the game for the war games on the back; The bag is 22 x 14 cm.

The rules describe two simple games, the Target Flight Game and the Capture Ships game.

Contents:

4 cardboard cards with the color-illustrated game boards for the Target Flight game.
8 game boards (2 per card) on the back of the Target Flight Game for the Capture Ships game. I believe the original game came with a small pencil.

boardgame.name: FindOut Medieval
boardgame.description:
This game will transport you into the magic and mystery of the medieval era. Choose your character, move with cunning among the rooms of the Castle and meet as many characters as possible. Let them help you find out who is hiding in the royal rooms and especially in the Princess’s room! Your Powers, together with those of the Special Cards, can benefit you but don’t let them escape and use them at the right moment… An engaging strategy game for all ages, with simple cards that will turn into squares to go through, recreating a mystery and an ever-changing story for each game. '

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 16th Avenue: The Country Music Game
boardgame.description:
In 16th Avenue players try to make it in the country music industry of the 1980s. The board spaces players move through are actual locations in the Nashville area.

Players start as struggling musicians and have to collect four items (e.g. an agent and a publishing contract) to establish a career, at which point they have to collect things such as a US tour and a gold album, etc.; there are four levels of success in all.

The game was self-published under the name "Grabbitt & Hyde."

boardgame.name: Cloudspire: Update Pack
boardgame.description: Bring your 1st print run edition of Cloudspire up to date with the latest revisions to the rulebook (with sample playthrough), scenario books (updates and improvements), reference sheets (more visual and intuitive), cards (clarifications), and some chips (talent alterations).

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 005)
boardgame.description:
From the website description

Welcome to issue #005 of the Cepheus Journal, the first issue without spaceships on the cover. In this issue, many settings are represented: Fantasy, Modern and Science Fiction.

For fantasy we have an article about Fighting Undead by Bob Weaver and a map of a Hidden Temple by Ade Stewart.

For a modern setting we have an article about British Cold War Tanks by Ewan Spence.

For Science Fiction settings we have Two articles by Neil Lucock. One about clothing and one about world building hellish worlds. We have an article about Jump Theory by Joseph Jaquinta. We have an article about Alternative Rules for Wealth by Ben Gray. Randy McDonald has written an interesting article about the close star Epsilon Indi.

From the editors we have an article about Hydrazine, one about an alien race, and one about an alternative method for planet sizes.

boardgame.name: Hive of Bone (Sci-Fi Starter Adventure)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

A hunk of space rock has been floating near one of the Star Republic’s space ports for some time. For a while, scientists believed that it was nothing more than your usual asteroid that had loosed itself from its general gravitational rotation. However, a probe sent to check it out has disappeared. It only managed to transmit one reading back before it vanished. The transmission seems to indicate that the asteroid is made up of . . . bone. Now, the Galactic Guild is asking members to take a ship out to the asteroid to inspect it more closely.

Hive of Bone is a starter adventure module for the Micro Chapbook Sci-Fi Roleplaying game. All the rules you need to play are included.

boardgame.name: Turkey Terror: VHS 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Turkey Terror is a roleplaying game of holiday horror survival. In the game, the player takes on the role of a normal everyday teenager or college student who is just trying to have Thanksgiving with their family when the “Turkey Invasion” begins.

Quickly, these characters become entwined in a plot by the turkeys to end the American Thanksgiving Holiday once and for all. Can you survive the invasion into the town of killer Turkeys?

Turkey Terror uses the Micro Chapbook RPG system--an ultra simple roleplaying game system that can be played solo or with a traditional GM if you so wish.

It is the second book in the VHS line of stand alone horror themed gamebooks for the system inspired by horror movies from the 70s, 80s, and 90s. This holiday special is a little shorter than other games in the system.

The main game focuses on solitaire gameplay, where you play a single teenager or college student fighting against the invading forces of flesh eating turkeys. It uses randomly generated game scenarios to make each game session a little different. This book also includes a premade adventure module to get you started. Other “VHS” series books will expand on the game and give you a more detailed world of terror to explore.

The universe for this game is brutal, unforgiving, and dark. You are a normal human surviving the Turkey apocalypse.

Expect to die and die often.

boardgame.name: Black Hats
boardgame.description:
Forget about range, cover, and terrain - on this virtual battlefield you trade trenches for subnets and fire support for computer daemons. The battles on the network aren't fought with soldiers, they're fought with runners: hackers who compete over lucrative data servers, filled with corporate secrets.

Black Hats is a head-to-head skirmish-sized tactics game. Players take turns commanding their runners, spending crypto to support them with cards from a custom-built cyberdeck, and hacking the network upon which you play. There are dozens of runners and cards to choose from in deck building, allowing you to craft a strategy that feels unique to you and your crew.

The tactical core of the game revolves around the hacking mechanic. Territory on the board is defined by connecting groups of same-colored hexes into "subnets," but both players can change the color of any space at any time, reshaping the board as you play. An enemy that sits across the board may be absolutely unreachable or just a single space away and, if you can outsmart your opponent, you control which.

Hire your crew, customize your cyberdeck, and hack your way to an early retirement. This is Black Hats!

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Owonikoko (The Money Hustle)
boardgame.description:
Owonikoko is played over seven rounds in which all players are engaged in the money hustle, striving to be the richest at the end of the game.

On active player’s turn the following actions are possible, however only 3 actions are permitted on active turn. This can be a combination of any action here or a repetition of one totaling 3 actions.
1. Draw card: player draws a card from the top of the draw deck
2. Play an action card (A.C): player plays an action card from hand and resolves said action
3. Play a counteraction card (C.C): player plays a counteraction card to stop or effect current active action
4. Sell goods: play goods card and gain gold accordingly

When not the active player, only one action is possible and permitted during other players turn
1. Play a counteraction card: play a C.C card to cancel effect of an active card, however this can only be done once while that player is active.

End of Game:
At the end of seven rounds, all players reveal their gold and richest player wins. If players tie, player with most goods win, if not they share victory.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The King's Coalition
boardgame.description:
Help the king of Athabasia assemble a coalition in Parliament to vote him the taxes he needs. You are trying to score the most points from your cards' face value and from bonuses; some bonuses are always available (such as a straight of at least six), while others vary and are only revealed as the game progresses.

Each turn, you draft a new coalition member into your hand from the deck or from face up cards. Usually you also discard, but peasant cards can be "enrolled" face up in your hand and don't require a discard. Total your points after six turns; after four games, high score wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Guess in 10: States of America
boardgame.description:
EXCITING GAME OF QUESTIONS – Ask up to 10 questions to guess the state on the Game Card! Does this state have a lot of beaches? Are the Red Sox from this state? Be the first player to win 7 game cards!

ABOUT THE GAME – This game is all about the 50 states of America! Learn all about what these states are known for, their characteristics, how they were named, & more in this super fun game of guessing! This game is for 2-6 Players.

WHAT’S INSIDE – Includes 50 Game Cards and 6 Clue Cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Horror at Headstone Hill
Horror en Heaston Hill
boardgame.description:
[from back of box]

Wild wind hisses through frosty sagebrush. Knife-sharp clouds cross a blazing white moon. In the quaking aspens that fringe the foothills, a shivering clatter draws the traveler with its siren song. Danger is everywhere, even in plain view. Welcome to Wyoming Territory, amigo! It's a place of wonder and beauty, but it ain't for the faint of heart.

Horror at Headstone Hill is a sandbox campaign setting, fully detailing this small section of the Weird West. As the heroes unravel the main campaign storyline they'll find themselves drawn into all manner of exciting adventures in and around Uinta County, Wyoming. It includes a handy booklet for players, a 128-page Marshal's book, a double-sided map, detailed player handouts, creature cards, pawns, and a unique wild die.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Horror en Headstone Hill (Electronic Spanish Version)
Horror en Heaston Hill (Softcover Spanish Version)

boardgame.name: Corrida dos Bichos
boardgame.description:
A fun race in which each player represents an animal, but no player knows who is what. Walking with all the animals is a way to confuse the players. The first three to cross the finish line receive medals, but only the player with the most gold medals is the winner. Come on, start the race and don't let them know you're winning.

Each player secretly draws an animal that they must represent and receive three cards.

On their turn, each player must choose one of the cards in his hand to discard and walk the same number of spaces indicated on the card, with the same animal drawn on it. Then he draws a card to replace his hand.

Special cards are used to bring new dynamics to the game.
The player whose animal crosses the finish line first will win.

boardgame.name: Weird West Pawns
boardgame.description:
[from back of box]

The Weird West is populated by all manner of strange beasts and colorful characters. Having the right creatures to challenge your posse is a constant struggle for a Marshal and that's where our Deadlands Pawns come in. These sturdy die-cut card miniatures are printed front and back with a selection f the most fearsome foes and hardy heroes in the Weird West.

Deadlands is the premier Weird West roleplaying game of action-packed horror. This set of pawns contains more than 80 unique characters and critters and more than 200 miniatures in total, complete with cardstock stands.

boardgame.name: Brutal Quest: Fantasy Narrative Skirmish Gaming Based on the Planet 28 Rules
boardgame.description:
Brutal Quest is a fantasy narrative skirmish game, built on the Planet 28 rules engine.

Brutal quest is designed to provide you with a set of simple wargames rules, allowing for fast and exciting games of miniature combat with warbands of kitbashed characters.

These rules can also be expanded with the in-depth campaign and narrative systems included, allowing you to add roleplay sessions, individual warband goals and long form story archs to your battles.

This book contains all the rules you need to play a game of brutal quest including custom character creation and advice on running campaigns.

Also included are a set of paper miniatures to allow you to get playing asap.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Berlin'84: A Cold War 3! Skirmish Level Wargame in Berlin
boardgame.description:
BERLIN ’84: Skirmish Rules for Cold War3!

August 1984, after tensions rise the unthinkable has happened!
World War III has started with the Soviet invasion of West Germany.
Berlin is surrounded and left to it’s fate with no possibility of being relieved or replenished, the units stationed in Berlin are in the fight of their lives as they are attacked on all sides by the East German Grenztruppen (Border Guards).
Desperate city fighting ensues.

Take command of either British or East German forces in street to street fighting in Berlin.
Each model represents one model and each side fields sections, with a platoon being the largest force fielded (though a company is do-able just rather large and may require more than two players!).
Each model can move and fight, with a simple wounding system.
Tanks are formidable beasts but can still be brought to their knees by rocket launchers and skill full tactics.

This title is fully compatible with ALL other titles produced by Rooksdown Games and written by Dean Wilson; so any title can be used in conjunction with this book, bringing your games of WWIII to a new level.

SIX (6) unique city fight scenarios are included as well as a full army lists for the (UK) Berlin Brigade including stats for the FV432/30 with 30mm Fox A/C Turret and for the East German Grenz. Regt. With BTR-152’s, T-55am’s and UAZ jeeps with RPG-11 recoilless rifles.

-description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990: 4th Edition

boardgame.name: Pays de Vitré-Fougères: Le jeu
boardgame.description:
Pays de Vitré-Fougères is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers of the Vitré-Fougères, and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, local celebrities....

boardgame.name: Superhero
boardgame.description:
A rock-paper-scissors card game with superheroes theme. Every player will be dealt a number of cards and they need to challenge other players during the game to keep their cards.
The superheroes cards correspond to three different elements: water, fire or woods, each one beats another one.

The player will the challenge card will challenge any other player. Both cards will take one card from their hands and at the shout of "Water, Fire, Wood!" they will reveal their cards. The stronger elements winds and the winner will gets both cards (unless there is a Power Eraser, that can be only used once). If both cards are identical, they are discarded.

The last player still having cards in their hands will be the winner of the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: 1517: Rescate en el viejo York
boardgame.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

«¿Quería ver a Leonardo da Vinci como cazador de muertos? Muy bien, señor, ¡aquí lo tiene!»

Niccolò Machiavelli

1517: Rescate en el viejo York es una campaña de la serie Leyendas de Ultima Forsan. Está dedicada a los personajes más célebres y fantásticos del Renacimiento Macabro.

El libro que tienes entre tus manos es un experimento único en la historia de Ultima Forsan, pues contiene una extraordinaria colección de material de juego inédito:

Quince aventuras.
Siete nuevas ventajas, a disposición de siete legendarios héroes.
Una campaña de juego, adaptada a las características de estas siete auténticas leyendas.
Un bestiario bien poblado de criaturas horripilantes y oponentes increíbles.
Una serie de reglas que os dejarán deslumbrados: armas excepcionales, dispositivos mecánicos de todo tipo, tablas para encuentros al viajar en barcos voladores, prótesis avanzadas, implantación de reliquias y efectos especiales del maná, que pueden ser útiles en muchas situaciones distintas.
¡Después de este manual, el Renacimiento Macabro nunca volverá a ser el mismo!
boardgame.rpgitemversion: 1517: Rescate en el viejo York (Spanish PDF Edition)
1517: Rescate en el viejo York (Spanish Physical Edition)

boardgame.name: Drachenzeit (Issue 5 - Nov 1988)
boardgame.description: contains an assortment of articles, short stories, a solo adventure, news, reviews.

boardgame.name: Vengeance: Roll & Fight – Episode 2
boardgame.description:
Vengeance: Roll & Fight is a real-time, roll-and-write game, where the frantic action around the table mimics the kick-arse fighting action in the game-world! Set in the world of Vengeance and designed by Dávid Turczi, Noralie Lubbers and Gordon Calleja, Vengeance: Roll & Fight is a stand-along game that transforms the fast-paced dice puzzles of the original Vengeance into roll-and-write mechanics where you’re building combos, striking off enemies and scoring points for an action-packed, brain-teasing fighting game that’s easy to learn and hard to master.

The aim of Vengeance: Roll & Fight is to infiltrate a gang den, carve your way through it’s rooms and killing the Boss, while completing side objectives printed on the dens themselves.

The game is split into three parts: planning, fighting and montage. In the planning phase players roll and re-roll 4 dice in real time, aiming to roll a combination of dice that match an ability they wish to trigger in the upcoming, fight phase. Assigning dice to an ability allows players to fill their hand back to 4 dice from a large, common pool and repeat the process as quickly as they can manage.

Once the dice pool is depleted, the fighting proper begins. Here players take a set of dice assigned to an ability and execute that ability, moving their piece through rooms full of enemies, and crossing them out when they are hit with the multitude of available abilities. Finally, players heal and upgrade their characters, bring new abilities and items into play to help them on their road to vengeance.

Vengeance: Roll and Fight comes in two boxes: Episode 1 and Episode 2. Both episodes are stand-alone games with the same rules, but with entirely different content: different heroes, dens, bosses, abilities and items. Each episode accommodates up to 4 players so combining the two increases the player count from 1-4 to 1-8! Content in both Episodes can be switched like-for-like as you choose.

boardgame.name: BLADE RPG Masterbook
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

BLADE is a swords and sorcery, tabletop role-playing game offering ease and strategy. With this 100-page guidebook, 2-6 Players assume the personas of fantasy Characters, guided by a Game Master (GM) to forge myths in their own heroic worlds.

Publisher's blurb:

BLADE is a swords and sorcery RPG offering ease, personalization, and strategy. Using this 100-page rulebook, Players assume the roles of fantasy Characters, guided by a Game Master to forge myths in their own heroic worlds.

This manual features complete rules for Players, helpful tips for GMs, over 50 creatures & Non-Player Characters, and over 100 items. Using unique spell-writing mechanics, weapon crafting, classless Character creation, and strategy-based combat, Players collaborate to become legendary heroes around their own tabletops.

From its first draft, Blade was designed with three concepts in mind. The rules should be quick to learn and easy to use, encourage creative problem solving, and have original flavor and mechanics.

BLADE fulfills each of these as one of the best RPGs to ever hit the game table. Classless Characters allow Players to develop hundreds of thousands of unique Characters based on classic archetypes or entirely original ideas. Open-ended Magic makes spells original, adaptable, and unpredictable, all from a concise, 100-page manual.

With brief rules, intense customization, and limitless strategy, BLADE is the perfect tabletop RPG for beginners and veterans like.

boardgame.name: The House of the Hollow
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A horror filled mansion-crawl compatible with MÖRK BORG role-playing game.

In The House of the Hollow, players will investigate a mysterious moonlit manor, home to a retired adventurer in the midst of a terrible transformation. Even before they encounter the moon-bound horrors lurking between the walls, navigating a decrepit house on the brink of collapse provides the players a significant challenge. A haunting revelation awaits travelers who enter the mansion, along with a powerful artifact ripe for the plucking.

The House of the Hollow is an independent production by Dylan Mangini and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License.

MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.

boardgame.name: Scoop
boardgame.description:
This game is a trivia game in the paper press world. It has no relation to the game Scoop from 1953.

The aim of the game it to become editor in chief of one of the ten newspaper of the game To achieve this, the player must create a team of journalists in a newspaper to become a section editor and then editor in chief.

At the beginning of the game a player is the advisor and place its pawn in the middle of the board. The first player start the roulette on the board, when its stops, he adjusts the board to be able to enter into a newspaper building. He will then have to answer to a question thanks to a combination of numbers on the board. If he answers right, he places a pawn of his color in the newspaper. He has begun his journalist team. If his answer his wring, he becomes the advisor. The others player can try to answer to the question during the hourglass time. The first that answer become a journalist in the newspaper.

Once all players are journalists in the same newspaper they can proceed the same to access to the chief of section rank. When a player is chief of section he proceeds the same to become editor in chief.

The first to be editor in chief wins.

boardgame.name: Drachenzeit (Issue 6 - Jan 1989)
boardgame.description: articles, short fiction, comic, reviews & news

boardgame.name: Reclaiming the Seal
boardgame.description:
The legendary people of Invicta created a Seal over the rift between the mortal realm and Demon realm, but now the Seal is breaking. In Reclaiming the Seal, you play as a descendant of Invicta and will return to the forgotten land to prevent the next Demon invasion.

Each player has up to five units to move across the hex grid map to explore the island in search of crystals, magical energy in physical form. These crystals repair the rift on the Seal in the center of the island. Players must also reactivate the Pylon towers around the island to help stabilize the magic around the Seal.

During the exploration, players will discover some Demons have already slipped through the rift in the Seal, and players will battle these monsters using dice combat. As players are all trying to accomplish the same goal, combat is player versus environment. Defeating Demons gives points and crystals.

Invicta was once a great nation, and needs to be rebuilt. Players will spend coins building Developments around the island. Additionally, these Developments produce coins each turn, allowing players to gain more assets in their quest to prevent a Demon invasion. While repairing the Seal and slaying Demons to gain points, players will also vie for activating the Pylons. Pylons give points for each adjacent Development at the end of game, creating a dynamic decision between players trying to end the game by repairing the Seal and activating the Pylon Network for immediate points, and players building a growing community on the island for scaling points.

On a turn, players move each of their Artificers and Paladins across the map and perform an action. Artificers build Developments to produce coins and Arcane Focuses that produce crystals. Paladins use crystals to repair the Seal. Both units can battle Demons, Artificers fight with a d6 while a Paladin fights with a d8. At the end of each turn, players produce coins and crystals based on the number of structures a player has built. Any time during a player's turn, they may take several other free actions including playing cards to gain new assets in their quest, enlisting more units if they have not reached their max number of units.

The end of the game is triggered when a certain number of Repair actions and Activate Pylons occur. The player who scored the most points represents the descendant most fit to lead the reclaimed country.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lullaby
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

In the fourth and final Act of Big Sleep, Lullaby, Tsathoggua’s rampage continues unchecked. Your heroes must delve deep into the caverns whence the Great Old One emerged. Here, you encounter ancient subterranean civilizations and primordial beasts. As you make your way to the lightless realm of N’Kai, Tsathoggua’s origin, you find terror, abomination, and stygian vaults. But somewhere in this nightmare realm is the secret behind the Sleeper’s power. Only you and your heroes have the skills to obtain it, and the knowledge to use it. But Tsathoggua is also aware and alert – will you be ready for the final showdown with the titan itself and its army of slithering monsters?

boardgame.name: A Land Out Of Time
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yig Snake Granddaddy is an amazing campaign in which evil serpent folk seek to bring back prehistoric times, complete with pterodactyls, dinosaurs, and other monstrous beings. In Land Out of Time, the first act of four, your player characters adventure into the wilds of Yilan, a primeval wilderness infested with carnivorous slime molds, gigantic crocodiles, and other lost horrors. There they encounter an evil serpent wizard, who prepares for an evil ritual beyond belief.Betrayed, marooned, and hunted by super-intelligent enemies, can the heroes even survive, yet alone prevail?

boardgame.name: Against the Serpentfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Captured by the serpent folk, the heroes find an unlikely ally – a mummified-yet-living being from the distant past. Cut off from the outside world, and stranded in the wilderness of Yilan, the heroes must rely on wit & grit to survive, building themselves a stable base out here in nowhere. But they must also bring the fight to the serpent folk, who relentlessly seek to destroy them, raiding with dinosaurs and worse. In addition to raiding the heroes and their friends, the serpent men are not idle – they now begin to awaken other terrifying civilizations from the distant past, forging an alliance that may turn time itself topsy- turvy.

boardgame.name: The Prehistory War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes are on the offensive, trying to undermine the ancients’ plans, but they can’t do it here – they must travel to the dreamlands to find new allies. But this is not all. Their ally, the mummified cat Dandelion, brings them into contact with a Yithian who opposes some members of his own race. Seeking to sabotage the Yithians, the heroes must mindswap themselves into molluscoid Yithian bodies. Can they trust their Yithian ally? No Yithian can be a true friend – he follows his own goals exclusively with obsessive skill. Finally they must hunt and capture alive a legendary super-snake which their enemies seek to summon Yig himself! Can they beat the serpent folk at their own game?

boardgame.name: The Ancient Ages Again
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With their enemies on the defensive, the heroes must try to knock both the Yithians and the Elder Things out of the war. But can they successfully campaign against entities who are wiser and more intelligent than even the smartest human?
Even if they succeed, it is to discover that nothing is more dangerous than a cornered snake. The serpent wizard plots to sacrifice an entire city to Yig and summon the Great Old One himself in an apocalyptic rain of deadliest venom. Can the heroes defeat Yig in person?

boardgame.name: Rätselspaß auf dem Bauernhof
boardgame.description:
On the farm all the animals have escaped. Who will help catch them? The players solve fun logic puzzles and learn where the animals are hiding. By matching, comparing and combining, the educational game playfully promotes logical thinking. Where are the eggs hidden? Which animal can crow?

—description from the publisher

This game works with the tiptoi-pen and can't be played without it.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – Munitorium Field Manual 2021 Mk1
boardgame.description:
The official guide from Games Workshop, providing points values for all units in the Warhammer 40,000 system.

Provided as a Promotional inclusion to White Dwarf #462 (March 2021)
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – Grand Tournament 2021 Mission Pack and Munitorum Field Manual 2021 MkII

boardgame.name: Entlang der Straße der Romanik Eine Quizreise durch Sachsen-Anhalt
Das große Sachsen-Anhalt-Heimatquiz
boardgame.description:
A quiz game (600 questions) that requires, as the name suggests, knowledge of Germany's state Saxony-Anhalt.

Players take turns to roll 2 dice and move the number of fields by either one die or by both dice round the track. The player then tries to answer a question determined by the black die (results 1, 2 or 3).

If the question is answered correctly the player receives chips, depending on the color of the field, he landed on. If the answer is wrong, a second player is given the question. A special field (the City of Magdeburg) gives the players the opportunity earning more chips. Everyone has to stay on Magdeburg till the last Player arrives getting each turn Questions with potential more points. Then the second part starts.

The game ends when the first player comes the second time to Magdeburg (different track).

The winner is the player to collect the highest value of chips.

boardgame.name: Let's Make a Bus Route: The Dice Game
boardgame.description:
In Let's Make a Bus Route: The Dice Game, each player is a member of a bus company and creates bus routes by drawing lines on a map. You want to meet the needs of each client — tourists, commuters, local university students, the elderly, and parents with children — while also considering congestion and traffic conditions. Who can create the bus route that pleases the most passengers?

In more detail, the game lasts 24 rounds, with you being the start player for half of those rounds. On a turn as the start player, you roll the six white dice in the game, then choose three of them, with the other player taking one of the remaining three dice. With the die results, you mark spots on the game board with an erasable pen to extend your bus route and pick up and drop off passengers. With bonuses, you can re-roll dice or roll an extra black die. After deducting traffic (and other) penalties, the player with the most points wins.

The game includes two maps: On the City Map, you must be mindful of the river as its bridges restrict your course at various points of the map. On the Mars Map, you can warp from one corner of the map to one of the other three corners, continuing your route across vast distances!

Let's Make a Bus Route: The Dice Game includes a solo mode that features mostly the same rules. The challenge is that you play the game twice on the same map with different colored markers, and re-using the same road in the second game causes traffic and negative points. How well can keep the routes separate to cover ground and make the most happy customers.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 129 - Rock and Roll and Write

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: New. Buyer pays shipping, CashApp/Zelle/Venmo accepted.

boardgame.name: Dino Hunt
boardgame.description: Two players try to remove dinosaurs from the their holes using suction hammers. The first player to achieve one of three goals (remove all the dinosaurs of their colour first, remove more dinosaurs than the other player, or remove the dinosaurs with the most total points) wins the game.

boardgame.name: CRAWLERS
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The hour is late. The sky is dark. A hard rain falls on the weak.

Govcorp rations out education, medicine, magic, and tech to the favored ones. The rest of you have to subsist on odd jobs. Androids, trolls, and the unliving grind out their time in menial roles, constrained by myriad arcane restrictions on their movement, speech, and behavior. Unlicensed witches are subject to burning, and a witch registration is very expensive to get. The only real freedom is the anonymity of the net, but even there Govcorp dominates with advertising and intrusive tracking. You're always just one step ahead of them, you think. But it's hard to be sure. Are they just waiting to trip you up?

Take the roles of revolutionaries, quiet or loud, trying to effectuate improvements in the daily lives of ordinary people under a dystopic plutarchy reinforced by magic and technology.

boardgame.name: Dr. Angus Mcdee's Collection of Birds
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Itinerant wizard, healer of the folk, illusionist, lord of smoke and mirrors, or you may also know him by his name: Doctor Angus Mcdee, the mystic figure who traveled all over these lands, but who is now dead, unfortunately. But wait! His stuff are now being sold in an Auction, as it was written in his will, this is your chance to grab his mighty, powerful and magic birds! Are you losing this unique chance?!

This is an eight-page mini zine that can be printed and build up on a single A4 sheet of paper. It contain 3 different magic birds with their detailed description.

boardgame.name: Suburbs!
boardgame.description:
Simple and quick tile-laying discard party game, where parks and cul-de-sacs are not always a good thing, and where chance and strategy play equal parts.

In this uno-meets-domino game, your goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand before other players, accumulating points each round.

Each card placed changes what can be played and where, so strategy allows you to plan for your hand, while frustrating the plans of other players.

Gameplay:
- Cards represent parts of a road/street – straight roads, bends, intersections, cul-de-sacs and a few parks.
- Each player is dealt a number of cards to their hand, depending on the number of players. One more card is placed face up on the table, as a starter for the neighborhood.
- In your turn, you must lay down a card from your hand that correctly connects to at least one other card on the table.
- There are a few special cards that make other players get a punishment (extra cards).
- First player to get rid of all their cards wins the round, and gets the points from other players’ cards.
- After several rounds, the winner is the first player to get to 200 points. For a quick filler you can also play without scoring, just to see who wins the round.

Suburbs! can be played from 2 to 10 players.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World Path Game
boardgame.description:
From the How to Train Your Dragon: Hidden World movie. Spin to move along the path and collect Dragon Tokens along the way. But watch out for the Dragon Catchers! The player with the most Tokens at the end of the path is the winner.

Includes: 4 character movers, 4 character stands, 1 light fury token, 1 spinner, 1 gameboard, 50 dragon tokens.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Movies: How to Train Your Dragon

boardgame.name: Empire of Fantasy (Issue 3 - May/ Jun 1987)
boardgame.description: A scenario and some smaller bits and bobs for DSA, NSCs to ramp up an unbalanced or weak Midgard party, and a solo adventure are among the contents of this issue.
boardgame.rpgissue: Empire of Fantasy: Das Magazin für Rollenspieler

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Detective
boardgame.description:
In the "Cthulhu Detective" adventure game, players take up investigations of different tangled cases and mysterious stories. Players are gathering clues, interrogating suspects and matching pieces of information to successfully solve the case.

During each turn, a player chooses one of the cards available this turn. These cards can represent a Clue, a Location, Witness Interrogation, Special Action, etc. Using the cards, which were received during investigation, a player discovers what actually happened. The objective is to solve a case in a minimum number of turns.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Hedge Lord
boardgame.description:
The Gentleperson's wager proclaims that who shall ever escape the maze, or be left the sole survivor of the beasts, shall be named the most honorable Hedge Lord, inheriting the splendid estates of all participants.

Hedge Lord is a game for 2-4 players where you are trying to get your lord out the exit on the opposite end of the hedge maze or to be the last lord standing. On your turn you roll the die and flip a coin. The die roll determines the movement of your lord and/or your beast. The coin flip determines whether or not you may rotate a hedge piece one quarter turn. Be careful! If your lord shares a space with another player's beast your lord (and beast) are out of the game!

Victory is not official until you take the flag, wave it in the air and proudly proclaim, "I am the Hedge Lord!"

boardgame.name: Verflucht!: Der Hinterhalt
boardgame.description:
Promotional post card.
Place the ambush postcard next to the creatures display area.

boardgame.name: Rilium
boardgame.description:
Have you ever had the feeling of opening a book and jumping into a sea of memories?

That’s because somewhere far away, in the depths of the ocean, there is a mystical library inhabited by a girl and her family of fish. Today, you’ll be able to help her organize the books for you alone.
Who will have the greatest joy while visiting your personal underwater library?

This game consists of two parts: the first part is called “Acquisitions” and the second part is called “Reading”. In the Acquisition section, you will collect books at the library by writing them on the library sheet, and in the reading section, you will read the books you have acquired. Read, and strive to make your library experience as pleasant as possible.

boardgame.name: Secrets of Gullet Cove Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore a magical campaign setting for fifth edition (or any tabletop RPG) with the new Animal Adventures sourcebook. Inside, you’ll find a place unlike any other—Gullet Cove!

It’s a wondrous seaside town home to brave heroes and dastardly villains, with intriguing mysteries and incredible discoveries waiting around every corner.

It takes a special kind of hero to make the most of all Gullet Cove has to offer, and these heroes are very special indeed. They’re awakened animals—cute, talkative, and longing to be unleashed on adventures!

Within this book is everything you need to begin exploring the Animal Adventures world:

Rules for creating your own awakened cat and dog characters
A gazetteer packed with information, plot hooks, and mysteries
A bestiary stuffed with villains, monsters, and potential friends
5 thrilling adventures to take you all over town
Magic items, Guild rules, and much, much more!


You can use this book to start a brand new campaign, or to add Gullet Cove to your existing campaign. What are you waiting for? Welcome to Gullet Cove!

boardgame.name: Fast Locations: Silverfish city
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Silverfish City!

Silverfish City is a village built over a stilt platform system on top of a lake: many secrets are hidden by the blue deep water, and many more lies in the dark alleys of the wooden houses that are as much active as night than during the day!

This booklet contains a description of the city history and locations, two maps of the city, and many plot hooks you can use to easily create a lot of different adventures in Silverfish City, especially useful when you don't have ideas or need something to give to your players fast.

boardgame.name: Building Better Benefits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Completing character generation in both Cepheus Engine (CE) and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) offers the Player the opportunity to throw on the Mustering Out benefits tables. The tables are adequate for giving the hero starting material and cash benefits, but the tables are too much the same; each table offers the same material benefits and a fixed amount of cash. The only variance seems to be which slots each item occupies.

Plus, the tables offer the same items to characters of different careers. While it’s within the Referee’s power to make substitutions or rewrite the tables altogether, another method might suit the campaign better: build the benefit tables as character generation progresses. This method takes the PC’s background into account and produces a customized table unique to that individual.

Building Better Benefits is a short supplement for CE and the OSFRPG, although it’s usable with other systems with a little work. It offers a variant method for granting mustering out benefits to characters completing their terms of prior service. Using a step-by-step, worked example, the Referee is shown how to customize the character’s career benefits while spending no extra time on the process.

Building Better Benefits. The bennies don’t have to be brevities.

boardgame.name: Superhuman Syndicates
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SOMETIMES IT PAYS TO BE THE BAD GUY…

Heroes are a dime a dozen, but a good villain? That’s something special. Everyone knows that a hero is only measured by the quality of the villains he faces anyway, so why not do away with the middleman? Embrace the dark side. Take what you want. Cast down all who stand against you. Let nothing stand in your way.

IT’S TIME TO GET PAID

Superhuman Syndicates is the latest in the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for the Tiny Supers Role-Playing Game, the award-winning minimalist superhero role-playing game! In these pages, you will find guidance on how to build or play the bad guys, from a simple team of supervillains to the most business-focused superhuman cartel, or even an international street gang! With tips, suggestions, sample characters, and a new campaign framework (complete with a new Trait), Superhuman Syndicates has everything you need to begin your career in villainy!

NO MEDDLING KIDS WILL STOP YOU THIS TIME!

boardgame.name: Familiars
boardgame.description: This supplement offers rules for familiars and homunculi for the Mörk Borg RPG.

boardgame.name: Minions of Evil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the minions of evil in your campaign.

boardgame.name: The Holocaust Baby
boardgame.description:
From the supplement:

Born in the center of the worst conflagrations in the West, its touch incinerates the righteous and the innocent.

boardgame.name: Through Fire and Smoke
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The sounds of battle echo off the ruined walls of a desecrated keep. Unnatural blizzards blind warriors locked in mortal combat, even as their blood turns the white snow to a bloody red. Heroes stumble through dark caves, harried by enemies on all sides as noxious gas chokes the life from them.

In the Mortal Realms, the very lands are your enemy.

This supplement presents dozens of new Environmental Traits for GMs to add to their creative arsenals when building encounters. Through Fire and Smoke expands upon the Environmental Traits presented in the Warhammer Age of Sigmar Soulbound corebook with an even wider array of Hazards and dynamic elements to enhance tactical gameplay and elevate the action to a whole new level. By adding exciting new threats and opportunities to the battlefield, players have more options to consider, more risks to manage, and more ways to interact with and explore with the Mortal Realms.

boardgame.name: Dashed Hopes & Twisted Pleasantries
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The world of MÖRK BORG can crush the hopes of any wanderer. Need to give your players a small bit of hope or respite? Then roll on this table.

Want to take away that hope? The event has an optional dark twist on the right of the page.

boardgame.name: King of Storms: Titan Queen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I look upon the seas and mountains, plains and valleys, cities and slums. I see mankind in all its forms, clutching to our very existence as a justification for their own pettiness and worthlessness. But I stand above them. I see through the eyes of the vermin and snakes. I take the form of their sins. I look back upon humanity and I know all their hypocrisies in one great, cloying stroke of failure. I wait for the clock of their finality to strike and I will sit upon the throne of heaven to watch it all fade to dust. Their wretched souls serve nothing, but a reminder of what not to be.”


One thousand years ago, the gods and titans slew one another in a great battle for the heavens. In their destruction, their blood rained from the heavens, permeating the earth, and drenching the soil. Centuries passed. From this blood arose powerful beings, capable of unearthly feats. Some were born of god’s blood, noble and perfect. Others were born from titans blood, twisted and malevolent. A third was born an abomination of the two — half god, half titan: the bloodless gorgons.

But the Storm is coming. The time of ascendancy is at hand. The kingdom can have but one ruler — the King of Storms. Which child of heaven shall take his or her place upon the throne?

And who will be consumed by the Storm?

Praxis is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters into dramatic situations and is based on the principles of the Protocol game system. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start-points, roles, plot twists, and finales. Praxis does not play like a traditional roleplaying game. It does not require a gamemaster. There is no script. No endpoint. No cumbersome or extraneous mechanics detracting from the story. An entire epic can be played in under four hours.

boardgame.name: Blaze Marches East
boardgame.description:
From the description:

It's a horse! It's some crows! Wait, it's… both‽ In times such as these, we must turn once more to those anonymous scriptures. Psalm IV, Verse 3:

Look to the West. Forth comes fire, and a horde, and the Kingdoms burn.

A fire-breathing, Colchis-complected horse homunculus; a flock of crows strung to it by a cacophony of clanging cables. It's hard to hazard who is pulling whom — but with a murder this foul, does it really matter? Run!

boardgame.name: Barrow of the Hill King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beneath a high barrowmound, topped with ancient stones, lies the Barrow of the Hill King

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multi level battlemap set of two 30x30 battlemaps depicting an ancient standing stone circle on a barrow burial mound, with an interior with tombs, catacombs and a royal tomb.

boardgame.name: New Atami Plaza - Post Apocalypse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hours ago New Atami was destroyed by a great cataclysm - do you dare enter the ruins for supplies?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a now-ruined futuristic cyberpunk city, post apocalyptic

boardgame.name: New Atami Plaza - Post Civilisation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long years have passed since New Atami fell, along with all civilisation. Now, the land is slowly being reclaimed by nature.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a long-ruined futuristic cyberpunk city, overgrown with plants..

boardgame.name: Sleep Now in the Fire
boardgame.description:
A Mörk Borg scenario. From the description:

4:3 Look to the West. Forth comes fire, and a horde, and the Kingdoms burn.

Although they went down, the fire of their spirits still raged on. And they came to burn it all and make you sleep in a fire.

boardgame.name: Smoke, Steel & Sinew
boardgame.description:
A Mörk Borg scenario. From the scenario:

The spawn of the Black Forge hath come forth. Their flesh weeps inside pyg iron cages, spurred forth by the infernal engines of their burning brimstone harts. They make camp in the shattered caustic ruins of their conquest.

boardgame.name: Intrepid: Mission Critical
boardgame.description:
Intrepid: Mission Critical is the first expansion for Intrepid: the cooperative and asymmetric survival game. It includes four new characters, with astronauts from Brazil, Germany, Malaysia, and the United Kingdom. Also included are 4 new Career Badges, giving you more variability. Test your skill against the Solar Storm, our most devastating disaster yet. Only the bravest crews will survive.

Components:
4 career boards
4 country boards (Germany, Malaysia, Brazil, UK)
4 country player aids
76 double-sided station tiles (19 per country)
1 disaster aid
22 disaster cards (solar storm)
6 unlock tokens (for Brazil)
4 country trays with lids
1 rulebook

listing.notes: This Kickstarter edition also includes the Intrepid: Kickstarter Exclusive expansion. If you need the base game Intrepid, I can bundle it with this order for $65 total.
Item is in plastic. Feel free to make a reasonable offer. Will ship or pick up for free in Atlanta, Georgia. I would also be willing to trade this for another boardgame. Feel free to reach out.

boardgame.name: Intrepid: South Africa Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
An exclusive Kickstarter character that was available as an add-on. It will be unavailable to the general public for at least 12 months after its release.

The South African astronaut rolls their dice into a single queue and are restricted to using only the dice at the queue's front. Dice further back in the queue are quite flexible and easy to manipulate but are much harder to gain access to. Thankfully, the South African astronaut has the ability to cycle the dice from the front to the back of the queue, allowing other dice to move forward - and hopefully provide access to the numbers they need.

Components:
2 career boards
2 country boards (South Africa 1 and 2)
2 country player aids
38 double-sided station tiles (19 per country)
2 country trays with lids
1 rulebook

boardgame.name: Super Earth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

EARTHJUMPERS is a micro-setting designed to be used with the Troika! RPG. In it, you play as a brave Earthjumper, humanity’s last chance at rebuilding Earth, after the devastating cataclysm that shattered it. In this pamphlet you can find all the details you need to run a mission on Earth #34351G, colloquially known as “Super Earth”, due to the existence of super-powered individuals. How will your team of ´Jumpers fare in this world, where a car can suddenly fall on their heads, buildings crumble atop of them, or be simply volatilized by a distracted “hero”? Will they find whatever the hell they’re looking for here, or will they (most likely) meet a gruesome end?

boardgame.name: Sea of Legends: Tantrum House Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
This promo pack contains two cards and was made available in the 2020 Tantrum House Kickstarter.

Ruffian: Exhaust to discard 1 Crew and gain their Gold value in Bonus dice.

Rogue: Exhaust after you take a Port action to gain 3 Gold.

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.
US shipping $1 International shipping $2
Shipping worldwide: 1.65 Please read Seller info below.

boardgame.name: Death Cube
boardgame.description:
In Death Cube, you are trying not to be crushed by blocks — or to crush people with blocks — depending on your role that turn.

The game takes place in a 4x5 grid that bears the numbers 1-20. Each turn, five spaces are covered on this grid based on whichever of the forty puzzle cards is chosen at random. If you are the "organizer", you are then presented with two pentominoes — i.e., five connected cubes — from a set of five pentominoes, and you have 24 seconds in which to decide how to fit these two pentominoes into the remaining 15 spaces of the grid. (The two are chosen at random from four possible choices, which means the game includes 160 total puzzles.)

If you're not the organizer, then you are a "participant", and you want to find a safe square among those 15 spaces where you will not be crushed by a block. Some squares will definitely be safe based on the pentominoes in the challenge, whereas other squares will be safe only depending on how the organizer decides to place the blocks. When you've made your choice, grab the numbered tile matching your chosen space so that no one else can take it.

boardgame.name: 金庫バトル (Safe Battle)
boardgame.description: In the game 金庫バトル (Safe Battle), you and your fellow players are master locksmiths who have gathered at a national tournament to open four safes by listening to their sounds. You can try to open them in co-operation with other locksmiths or go for a solo victory by relying solely on your own ears.
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: game no dendo (ゲームの殿堂)

boardgame.name: Voidheart Symphony: Psychic Rebellion in the Shadows of the City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There’s a wound in the world, a rot eating at hope and community and empathy. You’ve seen it in dark alleyways and gleaming boardrooms, gifting terrible power to those who will use it to hurt others.

You’ve had enough. You’re going to dive through that wound into the nightmare castle on the other side. You’re going to find the avatar of the one bringing you misery, and strike them down.

But what’s next, once you’ve stolen their power and ruined their ambitions? Will you return to your daily grind? Cherish those who are close to you? Or revel in the power you have taken from the void?

Because within that wound, the castle waits, and it is hungry.

boardgame.name: Dish Pit Witches
boardgame.description:
This is a game where you play as queer witches who work in a restaurant, using brute force, magic, and the power of gay to handle whatever your GM (General Manager) throws at you.

I wanted to experiment with making a game that is explicitly designed for the GM to be antagonistic toward the player characters, in a way that mirrors real life power imbalances most of us have had to deal with.

Please be sure to discuss safety tools before running the game. This may become especially important in a game explicitly designed to have a hostile GM role. See the TTRPG Safety Toolkit by Kienna Shaw & Lauren Bryant-Monk for a thorough survey of commonly used safety tools and consent mechanics.

This game works best with 3-4 players and a GM. Each player will need 2d6, a blank sheet of paper, and a pencil. It is designed in such a way that sessions can be very short or very long, depending on the amount of detail the GM decides to include.

Dish Pit Witches is a hack of Nate Treme's Tunnel Goons, made for the Goons Jam.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Alien Mating Calls
boardgame.description:
Alien Mating Calls is a hilarious party game that combines performing, deduction, and trickery. Your goal in the game is to score points by correctly pairing up with other players - while having the severe and silly limitation of only making alien noises.

The game is played over 6 rounds. A round begins with the first player prepping one of the alien decks and dealing each player one card. The card you get is your alien card for the round, and is kept secret from other players.

Players go around the table once, making a noise they think their alien might make. This is their clue to other players what alien they have. Then players simultaneously begin making their alien noises, during which each player decides to either pair up with another player by fist bumping them, or not pair up. When all players are ready to proceed, players reveal their alien cards.

Players score points based on how they paired up, with maximum points awarded to pairs of players who were alien partners and to single players who did not pair up and didn't have their partner in play. The player with the most points at the end of 6 rounds wins.

Subjective interpretations and the chance of a devious Mimic being in play makes commitment risky, and surprising misunderstandings are common. Optional Mood cards modify player calls, adding more replayability.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Imperial Herald (Volume 2, Issue 3 - 2002)
boardgame.description:
Season of the Mantis Exposed
Dark Secrets
Way of the Samurai
L5R Goes French

Zen's Card Focus
Koku Redemption
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (2nd Edition)

boardgame.name: Quarry Quarrel
boardgame.description:
Quarry Quarrel is a card-collecting game that works in voting rounds: all players secretly vote on which face-up card pile they want to collect, but if any pile gets multiple votes, then no one gets it!

Outsmart your opponents so you can add to your hand or stop them in their tracks. And discard sets of 3 cards between votes to draw more cards, double your points, or even end the game early.

The game ends when the Game Over! card is drawn or when a player ends the game early. The player with the most points in hand wins!

boardgame.name: Zoom Scouts
boardgame.description:
... I've never watched an episode of Power Rangers in my life. And yet, I'm pretty sure that this is accurate.

Zoom Scouts is an extremely silly story game. You are the Zoom Scouts, radical teens and tweens who have been granted martial arts prowess and giant robots that combine into the Mega Mech. But since soccer practice ran long, this episode of Zoom Scouts skips all the build up and opens with the giant robot.

Work together! Control a robot! Fight a monster! This is 100% goof-em-up role playing, made for playing on a video chat service (although you could do it live together if you're of a mind). Earn tokens by allowing the monster to beat up the Mega Mech; spend tokens to beat up the giant monster, and unleash your ultimate attack when the episode is almost over to save the day. Until next week.

Have you ever wanted to uppercut a kaiju all the way to the moon? Do you have detachable robot fists you don't intend to use until the final blow? Have you a yearning to find out what's going on at Sinister Sarah's dastardly space base? Then Zoom Scouts is here for you.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Darkness & Light – Mystic Arts
boardgame.description:
A myriad of masters of the mystic arts match up in this exciting issue of Vs. System® 2PCG®! You'll find both powerful heroes and villains alike whose only common bond is the ability to wield
magic and sorcery. Will they be able to work together, or will they unleash chaos upon your deck...

Contents:
55 Playable Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

listing.notes: Title: Vs. System 2PCG: Darkness & Light – Mystic Arts Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Darkness & Light – Masters of Evil
boardgame.description:
This volume of Vs. System 2PCG kicks off with a polarizing story arc blending the forces of good and evil. First up are the true masters of evil - a dastardly collection of the most nefarious villains, banded together with a new team affiliation. This set introduces Baron Heinrich Zemo, Radioactive Man, and more!

Contents:
55 Playable Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: The Omegas
boardgame.description:
In this aptly named conclusion to the Omega level story arc for Vs. System 2PCG, your deck will be filled with an A-list of powerful mutants. Massive mutant ability will surely classify your deck as Omega. Vs. System 2PCG: The Omegas includes some of the mightiest mutants like Jean Grey, Legion, and Storm whose Omega level powers are among the most dominant in the Vs. System 2PCG game. The level of advantage this issue brings to your deck can only be classified as, Omega.

Contents:
55 Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

listing.notes: Title: VS System 2PCG: The Omegas Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: Freedom Force
boardgame.description:
What happens when you give control of your deck to a band of “reformed” ruffians? The shapeshifting Mystique leads her version of the evil Brotherhood of Mutants with a cast of characters who will create law and order by any means necessary. Build your deck with the power of questionable tactics that yield unquestionable results. Freedom Force is the second issue in the Omega Level story arc and includes the incendiary Pyro, the ground shaking Avalanche and more!

Contents:
55 Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

listing.notes: Title: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: Freedom Force Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Vs System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: Futures Past
boardgame.description:
Futures Past is the 1st issue of the Omega Level story arc.

It expands on the ever popular roster of heroes and villains from the X-Men family of characters. This issue is a tragic reminder that there's just no stopping the mutant-hunting robotic Sentinels, as they scour the globe, intent on decimating all mutantkind with their iron fists! This nightmarish scenario facing your deck is well balanced by the likes of powerful mutants like Kitty Pryde and Logan!

Contents:
55 Cards
1 Rulesheet

listing.notes: Title: Vs System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: Futures Past Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Roll 'N Score: Official Toronto Maple Leafs Hockey Game
boardgame.description: Roll 'N Score is a dice game with rules very much like real hockey. Two teams play against each other. There are power plays, breakaways, and penalties-just like real hockey. As you play, the totals on the dice, when you have rolled them, tell you where to move. The squares on which you land tell you what to do (for example, penalty of " holding" -you go to the penalty box for two turns). Everything your team does-goals, assists and penalties-is written on the scoresheet.

boardgame.name: Historia Dark Fantasy Renaissance Setting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Historia is a Renaissance Dark Fantasy setting for the fifth edition of the world's most famous role-playing game that introduces the continent of Vesteria, a ruthless land full of intrigue and populated by anthropomorphic animals.

Characters will face the hardships and dangers of a feral and precarious world. The heroes of Historia will explore unknown lands, unravel plots and intrigue, and be forged by the fire of adventure.

This corebook includes:


18 new playable races, called Familiae, divided into Species that allow you to play as over 50 different types of anthropomorphic animals;
10 new classes designed to fit a Renaissance setting, each with different archetypes.
Firearms rules and historically accurate equipment;
New backgrounds that will further the destiny of the characters, the Ventures;
A new system of Factions and Careers with ranks and prestige
New rules for all your 5th Edition games;
Encounters and characters from the world of Historia.

boardgame.name: Carrots
boardgame.description:
Object of the game is to end the game with the most carrots. Players will have to masterfully decide to Farm, Steal, Gamble, Bank, or use Rabbit Hole cards to obtain carrots. There are 5 rabbits to choose from. On setup of the game the player will choose to either be the Farmer, Thief, Gambler, Tax Collector, or Insurance Broker. Each rabbit has their own special ability. There are three piles of cards (Farm, Steal, and Rabbit Hole). You start off with 24 cards in each deck, any extra cards will be removed from the decks and placed in the box. Thirty carrots per player will be used to create the Harvest.

A player's turn will consist of the following:
1. Remove any Closed Tokens that were put into play on their last turn.
2. Receive any carrots via farming or banking. If a player cannot receive any carrots they will receive 1 carrot from the harvest.
3. The player will complete one of the following.
A. Purchase a Farm Card (Cost 0 carrots)
B. Purchase a Steal Card (Cost 1 Carrot)
C. Purchase a Rabbit Hole Card (Cost 3 Carrots) Rabbit Hole Cards may be played at anytime during the player's turn. The only exception to this rule is if the card has a carrot with a lightning bolt and or a rabbit with a fire on its head.
D. Gamble
E. Bank *Note if more than 4 carrots were banked on the player's last turn, they may not bank this turn.

If one of the card piles or the Harvest gets depleted, this will trigger the end game. Any Rabbit Hole cards left will be counted as 2 carrots unless card otherwise specifies. The player with the most carrots wins. In the event of a tie, the player who took their final turn earlier will be declared the winner.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Year After Year
boardgame.description:
Year After Year is a tabletop RPG about an ordinary family living through tumultuous change. We follow their trials and tribulations as the years roll by, with political, technological and social upheaval rocking their world.

YaY is a fairly freeform game, using a simple structure to enable you to generate exciting imagined futures, beginning with the near-future and rolling forward into strange times indeed. The game keeps a focus on the family, their drama and relationships, but getting them caught up in the relentless change that is the theme of the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Working For the Corp
boardgame.description:
'Working For the Corp is a cyberpunk print and play Descended From the Queen game. You will play characters who work at a megacorp called "The Corp" who are tasked with defending sensitive information from runners. Will you defend The Corp?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ツクルテン (Total Ten)
boardgame.description:
In ツクルテン (Tsukuruten), you score points in the round if you can add up the eight cards in front of you to sum to 10. This challenge is complicated by the deck containing eight cards each of numbers 1-7, with half the cards being red and half blue — which means almost every set of eight cards will sum to more than 10!

The trick is that certain combinations of cards are worth less than their face value:


Three cards of the same color and number = 0
Three red cards in sequence are worth only the highest number in the sequence, so a red 345 = 5.
Three blue cards in sequence are worth only the lowest number in the sequence, so a blue 345 = 3.


Each player starts with a hand of eight cards. On a turn, draw a card from the deck, then (if you don't have a sum of 10) discard a card in a row in front of you; alternatively, you can pick up the discarded card of the player before you, add two cards from your hand to this card, play it beside you as a special sequence (a "get"), then discard a card. The cards in that "get" cannot be altered for the remainder of this deal, but they still count as being in your hand toward the desired sum of 10.

When someone does reach a sum of 10, whether by drawing a card or picking up a discarded card, the round ends, with players scoring points based on the combinations they've made and certain conditions in their hand. Having only one 7 in hand is worth 1 point, for example, as is having four red and four blue cards, whereas having all cards of one color or two triples are each worth 3 points. You also score points for being the one to end the round.

Play enough rounds so that each player starts a hand twice, then whoever has the most points wins. Alternatively, if a player collects a "God Ten" — that is, all eight 2s or all eight 5s, each of which sums to 10 — they win the game instantly!

boardgame.name: Valhalla: Additional Dice Set
boardgame.description: The base game came with 2 sets of player dice (in red and black). The Additional Dice Set provides 24 dice in the remaining 4 player colors (6 each) so that each player has their own set.

boardgame.name: Go Adventure
boardgame.description:
Go Adventure is a family-friendly card game that was inspired by one of the game creators going out on 'adventures' with his son. Sometimes their adventures didn't always go as planned. This hard-learned lesson to pack appropriately gave way to inspire children to also think creatively about going out on adventures. The objective of the game is to fully “pack” the required items needed to go on eight different adventures. The gameplay is simple and straightforward. The cards are brightly colored and cheery. Laughter will certainly ensue.

Players can only play one card during their turn but they have four choices of card type to play. They can play a Required Item card on an adventure thereby 'packing that item'. If the player places the last required item needed to be packed for an adventure, then they get to keep that adventure card pile. This drives the primary objective of the game. The remaining choices purely drive the fun secondary elements of the game. A player can use a Skip-a-Turn card thereby skipping the next player in order. A player can use a Funny Action card, which forces someone in the group to do something fun and silly that relates to the adventure themes. Lastly, a player can use a Random Item card, which can be placed on any of the adventures but the player must make up a story about how that item will be used on the specific adventure. This adds a fun storytelling element to the game. Gameplay continues until all eight adventures have been fully “packed” for and the winner is the player with the most completely packed adventure piles in their possession.

Go Adventure is unique in its mission to get kids thinking about what adventure means to them as well as what needs to be packed to go on adventures. The gameplay is quick, around fifteen minutes, and the storytelling element will continue to provide exciting replayability for families. Any extra inspiration kids and parents find to get out there and go on new adventures is free of charge!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Chivalry and Sorcery (5th Edition) Quick Start Rules
boardgame.description:
From the foreward
Welcome. You hold in your hands the Quickstart rules for the new edition of Chivalry & Sorcery. These Quickstart rules and the pre generated characters and adventure are intended to give you a taste and feel of C&S. The Core Rulebook contains so much more.

C&S is a very, very old game, having been enjoyed through its many incarnations for more than 40 years. This new fifth edition has been carefully and purposefully re-thought, tidied up and altered for ease of play, as well as to deepen the sense of immersion into a medieval world with added fantasy.

This volume is a taste of what is in the Core Rulebook.
Good reading and fun gaming …

boardgame.name: ラムラムパーティー (Lum Lum Party)
boardgame.description:
ラムラムパーティー (Lum Lum Party) is a bingo-type game where the players are given two blank bingo sheets and following a set of rules, will choose what numbers go in each box.

On a turn, a player chooses from 4 actions in order to "call" the next number the players will hope to circle on their sheets. These actions will vary slightly depending upon the last number "called".

At the end of a round, players score points for their place in getting their first bingo; numbers circled; and tens-digits of numbers circled. The player with the highest total score after two rounds wins.

Nearly a quarter of the rules are devoted to the designer's love of the manga series, Urusei Yatsura; this is where the game gets its name.

boardgame.name: Of the Horned God's Winter
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Beyond the Inner Sea lie the High Mountains of the Holmgard, the Roof of the World. Here the country is wild, and dangerous, sparsely settled by barbarians, dwarves, and the occasional mad wizard. It is a hard land of narrow paths, deep canyons, cliffs without purchase; a land of snow and ice that offers little comfort for those who risk her high walks. It is a land of giants where giants once roosted, where dwarves built homes and dungeons. It is a land wholly forgotten but rich in lost treasures that echo a world long gone. It is one rich in adventure, filled with wealth beyond imagining and glory for those who do not fall.

Beyond the mountains lies the Gottland, the land without gods. This too is a land of imagined treasures, where giants, trolls, and gods with cloven feet have walked for countless years. Many venture here, but only a few realize the dream of wealth everlasting for it is a hard place of primordial violence, ancient magics, and one of the last vestiges of the Horned God's Winter.

Of the Horned God's Winter is a series of loosely connected adventures that take the characters from the sea town of Capistria, through the Holgrad Mountains and down into the Gottland. Along its path, the characters may, at the CK's discretion, encounter rune magic, either for their Rune Mark or for the character wishing to become one. The 15 adventures are designed to play alone or or as part of a broader campaign arc. Each adventure is written such that the enterprising CK can add their own adventures to the mix.

Of the Horned God's Winter is designed for a party of 4-6 characters of 4th-7th level. It includes overland adventures, sea adventures, dungeon, and castle.

boardgame.name: Strange Victory
boardgame.description: A solitaire design, this game illustrates how the smaller but nimbler Germans got "inside" the Allied decision cycle to constantly impose small delays and major "rethinks" producing a catastrophic failure on the Allied side - though the better the Germans do may well panic their own High Command into halting them.

Each player plays as a merchant in Yokohama, trying to succeed in business and make a name for themselves.

In the game Yokohama, the game board is divided into different blocks. There is a city block where you will allocate your employees,and a port block where you will need to fill contracts from foreign countries. Skillfully deploy your employees to different areas of the city block and use them to perform area actions to earn trade goods as well as complete other tasks. Players load their trade goods to fulfil contracts in the port block. In addition, there are various technologies that can be learnt from foreign countries due to the opening of the port, and efficient use of these technologies is also a shortcut to victory.

Which player will become the number one merchant in Yokohama?
